memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: All< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns true if all elements in the Query satisfy the predicate.
Returns true if all elements in the Query are equal to the same value. Will always return true for Queries with one or zero elements.
Returns true if the Query has any elements in it.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: Any< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns true if any elements in the Query satisfy the predicate.
Returns the average of a Query of floats.
Returns the average of a Query of doubles.
Returns true if any element in the Query is equal to a specific value.
Returns the number of elements in the Query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: Count< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of elements in the Query that satisfy a predicate.
Counts the number of distinct elements in the Query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, K > selector)
memberdef.name: CountUnique< T, K >

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of distinct elements in the Query once it has been mapped using a selector function.
Returns the element at a specific index in the Query. Will throw an error if the Query has no element at that index.
Returns the element at a specific index in the Query. Will return the default value if the Query has no element at that index.
Returns the first element in the Query. Will throw an error if there are no elements in the Query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: First< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the first element in the Query that satisfies a predicate. Will throw an error if there is no such element.
Returns the first element in the Query. Will return the default value if the Query is empty.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: FirstOrDefault< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the first element in the Query that satisfies a predicate. Will return the default value if there is no such element.
Returns Some value that represents the first value in the Query, or None if there is no such value.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: FirstOrNone< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the Some value representing the first value that satisfies the predicate, or None if there is no such value.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, T, T > foldFunc)
memberdef.name: Fold< T >

briefdescription.para: Folds all of the elements in the Query into a single element, using a fold function. Will throw an error if there are no elements in the Query.

detaileddescription.para: The fold function takes in the current folded value, and the next item to fold in. It returns the result of folding the item into the current folded value. For example, you can use the Fold operation to implement a sum:

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the first element that is equal to a specific value. Will return a negative index if there is no such element.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: IndexOf< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the first element to satisfy a predicate. Will return a negative index if there is no such element.
Returns the last element in the Query. Will throw an error if the Query is empty.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: Last< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the last element in the Query that satisfies a predicate. Will throw an error if there is no such element.
Returns the last element in the Query. Will return the default value if the Query is empty.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: LastOrDefault< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the last element in the Query that satisfies a predicate. Will return the default value if there is no such element.
Returns Some value that represents the last value in the Query, or None if there is no such value.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: LastOrNone< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the Some value representing the last value that satisfies the predicate, or None if there is no such value.
Returns the largest element in the Query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, K > selector)
memberdef.name: Max< T, K >

briefdescription.para: Returns the largest element in the Query after it has been mapped using a selector function.
Returns the smallest element in the Query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, K > selector)
memberdef.name: Min< T, K >

briefdescription.para: Returns the smallest element in the Query after it has been mapped using a selector function.
Returns the first and only element in the Query. Will throw an error if the length of the Query is anything other than 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: Single< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the first and only element in the Query that satisfies the predicate. Will throw an error if the number of such elements is anything other than 1.
Returns the first and only element in the Query. Will return the default value if the number of elements is anything other than 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: SingleOrDefault< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the first and only element in the Query that satisfies the predicate. Will return the default value if the number of such elements is anything other than 1.
Returns the first and only element in the Query. Will return None if the number of elements is anything other than 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, bool > predicate)
memberdef.name: SingleOrNone< T >

briefdescription.para: Returns the first and only element in the Query that satisfies the predicate. Will return None if the number of such elements is anything other than 1.
Returns the sum of a Query of ints.
Returns the sum of a Query of floats.
Returns the sum of a Query of doubles.
Returns the single value that is present in the entire Query. If there is more than one value in the Query or there are no values at all, this method will return the default value.
Returns Some single value that is present in the entire Query. If there is more than one value in the Query or there are no values at all, this method will return None.
Converts the Query into an array.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, T[] array, int offset=0)
memberdef.name: FillArray< T >

briefdescription.para: Copies the elements of the Query into an array. Can optionally specify the offset into the array where to copy.
Converts the Query into a list.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, List< T > list)
memberdef.name: FillList< T >

briefdescription.para: Fills a given list with the elements in this Query. The list is cleared before the fill happens.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, List< T > list)
memberdef.name: AppendList< T >

briefdescription.para: Appends the elements in this Query to the end of a given list.
Converts the Query into a HashSet.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, HashSet< T > set)
memberdef.name: FillHashSet< T >

briefdescription.para: Fills a given HashSet with the elements in the Query. The set is cleared before the fill happens.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, HashSet< T > set)
memberdef.name: AppendHashSet< T >

briefdescription.para: Appends the elements in this Query into the given HashSet.

memberdef.definition: static Dictionary<K, V> Leap.Unity.Query.QueryCollapseExtensions.ToDictionary< T, K, V >
memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, K > keySelector, Func< T, V > valueSelector)
memberdef.name: ToDictionary< T, K, V >

briefdescription.para: Converts the Query into a Dictionary using a specific key selector and value selector.

memberdef.argsstring: (this Query< T > query, Func< T, V > valueSelector)
memberdef.name: ToDictionary< T, V >

briefdescription.para: Converts the Query into a Dictionary using the query elements as keys, and using a value selector to select the value tied to the key.
